description: Unknown vulnerability in pam_ldap before 180 does not properly handle a new password policy control, which could allow attackers to gain privileges.  NOTE: CVE-2005-2497 had also been assigned to this issue, but CVE-2005-2641 is the correct candidate.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-2641

description: Buffer overflow in the mutt_decode_xbit function in Handler.c for Mutt 1.5.10 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code, possibly due to interactions with libiconv or gettext.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-2642

description: Tor 0.1.0.13 and earlier, and experimental versions 0.1.1.4-alpha and earlier, does not reject certain weak keys when using ephemeral Diffie-Hellman (DH) handshakes, which allows malicious Tor servers to obtain the keys that a client uses for other systems in the circuit.

description: Buffer overflow in JaguarEditControl.dll in Isemarket JaguarControl allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a long Jtext field.

description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Xerox MicroServer Web Server in Document Centre 220 through 265, 332 and 340, 420 through 490, and 535 through 555 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML and modify web pages via unknown vectors.
